snippet: The border police, whose green berets are a nod to the Green Line that demarcated Israeli territory from its hostile neighbors in 1949 armistice agreements, serve in the most sensitive situations.
abstract: Israeli border police, serving in number of dangerous capacities in territorial dispute with Palestinians, are at center of rising concern over what critics see as Israel's heavy-handed security presence; some officers stand accused in 2014 of misconduct in several episodes that have been videotaped and broadcast across the globe.

byline.contributor: Rina Castelnuovo and Irit Pazner Garshowitz contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The border police, whose green berets are a nod to the Green Line that demarcated Israeli territory from its hostile neighbors in 1949 armistice agreements, serve in the most sensitive situations.

headline.main: Patrolling a Disputed Line, Israeli Border Police Become a Focus of Anger
headline.print_headline: Patrolling a Disputed Line, Israeli Border Police Become a Focus of Anger
